TED HENDRICKS.raw_line: Ted Hendricks. Vice President of Acquisitions.Managing the acquisition. Identifying overlap. Reducing staff where we find redundancy. What's your focus been here, Gary?Wow, okay. That's not...No. What do you do?Do you play an important role here?I'm sorry. I was really getting into this song. What were you saying?Let's talk later. We have a specific time set aside to conference with employees of the former company.I'm not sure. But it's not at this time.I have to see the board and start evaluations now.I'll come by sometime this week.How's the issue shaping up?The photographer?What does Quintessence mean?Okay. Awesome.(repeating to himself forWho am I evaluating next?(correcting him, a little more quietly, just toMost of them.Okay. So, we're very excited to play a part in publishing what will be the very last issue of Life Magazine, which has been an American Institution for 75 years and whose renowned covers have touched us all really touching ways. And for the final issue, our cover is going to be something which is... What was that word?Our cover will probably be the most famous ever because it really has the awesome quintessence of Life. And we're all going to be a part of this historic happening. Even those of you who will, right after the happening, be asked to leave. Thank you.Yes, sir. It's gone very smoothly. The last issue's underway. The cover? Yeah. It's amazing. It's so quintessence. It encapsulates majesty. Totally. It has some splendor, in it, too, probably. Also, I'm pretty sure it's illustrious and just really awesome. It took my breath away. And I haven't even seen it yet. We're getting it processed from practical assets now. Yes, sir. We're going to retain eleven employees. I'm going to be evaluating them over the next week.You're vital here?Why are you holding toys?...you wanted toys.(nodding at Walter'sYeah, you're toy.A photographic negative? I thought those had all been processed?I know. Because I've been asking for it. Because it's the Quintessence fucking one that I told my boss we had. It's the cover. You seriously lost a photographer's work? At Life?Why are you confident we'll find it?That doesn't give me confidence, a no-answer. You're in assets, I guess?This doesn't reflect very well on you.During an evaluation week.(gesturing out his cellDon't Helmut Newton me.Hey. We've held up publication of this issue because I told my boss that photo was fucking amazing. Okay? We've spent a hundred and nine thousand dollars because of the overage. You lost an amazing PHOTO--Where is he?Do you know what "fired with cause" means?I have cause to fire you. You won't pick up another check. I can let you go without severance because-You lost a Sean O'Connell. It was quintessence. He's a war photographer? Cubicle, you're going to tell this brave photographer, risks his life, that you, a male sitting in an office, lost--?Do you work at one?What are you named?What's your name?Want to try the Four Seasons?

CHERYL.raw_line: (can't make it out clearlyYou lost a Sean O'Connell?Maybe Sean has it.Have you figured anything out?Six billion.Two, too, what?Yeah. But I think there are more Starbucks, so I don't know if that's what you'd call a hot trail--(having some fun with...What did you do this weekend?My son and I went on a bike ride in Lake Valhalla. Jersey. We brought lunch. Had lunch in an actual field, of grass. We went swimming. My friend Marny lives on the lake. (getting to what's on everyone's minds aroundI can't believe they left it in the park. How old is this?Your sister just took off?No kidding, man.Braces. How old is she?You're sure this is your sister's parking space?When?Thanks.See you tomorrow.I'm going to drop Rich at his Dad's. Thanks, Walter.Just barely.Okay. One, two, three.Okay, okay. One two three.Rich...?Rich?It's okay. Come here. Hey come here.Hey, it's okay.Hey, don't worry. You're good. Don't worry. Hey...Don't worry, about a thing, `cause every little thing, is gonna be all right. Don't worry. About a thing...Hey.Did you find the Quintessence of Life?Man, I'm sorry. How are you feeling?(impressed about theDo you have any idea where Sean is now?Honey. Hey. Come here. That was great.That was really great. Here.Hey. Don't worry. You're going to feel fine in five minutes. Don't worry. Hey.Don't worry, about a thing, `cause every little thing is going to be all right. Don't worry.....You know, all hell broke loose this week, while you were gone.How'd the move go?Everybody's good?The company or the... thing.The company's okay. The thing's tough.Are you glad you're not there anymore?What's the new stuff?Yeah...The ninth? Is that good? Two days?Yeah, cool.Is that your mom?She's good.

SEAN.raw_line: What's with all these shoes?That's a lot of shoes, man.Thanks for doing all the field work here and risking your ass and getting hit by shoes and stuff.Walter?...you have it.No, it's not in the neg box. That one was special. Favorite ever. You have it. Seriously. Loan me five bucks.Loan me five bucks....Hey, man, do you mind?I'm trying to photograph a snow leopard.Yeah.Yeah.Walter. Seriously. What the fuck? What are you--Sit down....Are you okay?Take your time.That negative you asked me about.12?You're sitting on it.Because it's in your wallet.That was the gift. The picture. The wallet was just someplace to keep the picture. I put it in the little picture slot in the wallet. The little picture holder. I thought that would be cute. I said "look inside." In the note.Shhh...What?The picture?The wallet?So you have no idea what it is?The picture?Do you want to know what it was? It was great.Hey.Real life.They're pretty rare.Your hand's over the lens.There you go.

EDNA.raw_line: Hi, honey.Hi, Walter. Is it all right I'm dropping by?Well, she's the artist...I named her after a wonderful visit your Dad and I had to Odessa, our family's homeland, one summer, in southern Ukraine. There's a beautiful river there also named Odessa.I named you after Walter MatthauSo the moving bill came, for my move down here. I wanted to bring it by. Thank you so much Walter.Hi, Walter.Oh, I'm just making some yogurt. With some banana.It snowed today. Didn't expect that. Not much. Just a light little cover. Very pretty. Less than an inch even.My piano got towed, Walter.Yes. Odessa said it wasn't there. Where you said it was going to be.She said possibly that it got towed. That that's not her space anymore.Where are you, honey?That's nice.I just wanted to thank you for my Villa. Odessa told me all about it. It sounds so pleasant. Villa. That guy was a real dick.Anyway, hon, you've really become the man of the family, and I wanted to say I love you, and Happy Birthday.What a dick. Big man. Big warlord of the fortieth floor--I was just discussing them. Last week. They rule over small areas of land using threats, and force bribes of livestock or klipspringers.Yes.In some parts of the world they carry small deer like we carry, say, quarters. To pay bribes. Also, blankets or clothing items like koofiyads.Yes, for the warlords.Yes?Sean?No. I took it. With Sean's camera.From Sean. He came to visit.He came to visit. To talk about you.Yeah. He asked me some questions about you? What your work schedule was, when you left, when you came home. He said you really understood Life. He wanted to know about your work. He said you "got Life."I just sent him my recipe for Clementine cake? To his email. I packed him some when he left. He just loved it. We snacked on some during our Warlord conversation.He's in Nepal now, I think. Photographing snow leopards. Let me think. Yes. Ship. Iceland. Mogadishu. Nepal. That's what he said.I didn't know that. You don't talk about work that often.I was concerned we couldn't keep it, Dear. I know it's a burden. I didn't know if we could manage. So I thought I might not see it again. I wanted a picture.That's not a very good picture. But that's okay. She's right here.You know, I wonder sometimes... you had to start work so early. Orange Julius. Then all through college. At Avis. Then Pizza delivery. That shitty pizza. Then at this company.I wish maybe you had the chance, a greater chance to pursue your dreams.What did you want to be, when you younger?Sure you do. Everybody does.Thanks for taking care of us, Walter.
